Stories published in March, 2020

March 31, 2020

How to protect your Stanford Zoom meetings Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/31/protect-stanford-zoom-meetings/

University IT is seeing an increase in Stanford Zoom meeting abuse while also hearing news of “Zoombomber” incidents here and at other institutions where interlopers have disrupted virtual events.

March 30, 2020

The productivity pitfalls of working from home in the age of COVID-19 Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/30/productivity-pitfalls-working-home-age-covid-19/

Nicholas Bloom is widely known for his research showing the benefits of working from home. But in the current coronavirus crisis, the economist fears productivity will plummet.

March 30, 2020

Modeling social distancing’s impact Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/30/modeling-social-distancings-impact/

Biologist Erin Mordecai discusses different social distancing strategies, how long we may need to maintain them and the risk of a disease resurgence if precautions are lifted too early.

March 30, 2020

Motivation, provenance of disinformation is pivotal in news reporting Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/30/motivation-provenance-disinformation-pivotal-news-reporting/

Stanford scholars Janine Zacharia and Andrew Grotto discuss strategies for reporters and editors to write about disinformation, leaked material and propaganda in a responsible and timely way.

Stanford Engineering — March 27, 2020

As electronics shrink to nanoscale, will they still be good as gold? Link: https://engineering.stanford.edu/magazine/article/electronics-shrink-nanoscale-will-they-still-be-good-gold

Engineers wonder whether this tried and true precious metal, found in the bowels of most electronic devices, can stand up to the strain of next-generation data processing.

March 26, 2020

Faculty Senate approves academic policy changes in response to COVID-19 Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/26/faculty-senate-meets-virtually/

At a special emergency meeting on March 26, the Faculty Senate approved a variety of new academic policies, including implementing a Satisfactory/No Credit grade for spring quarter.

Stanford Engineering — March 26, 2020

The race to save the ocean Link: https://engineering.stanford.edu/magazine/article/fiorenza-micheli-race-save-ocean

Fiorenza “Fio” Micheli grew up on the Mediterranean Sea, where she fell in love with the ocean and made it the object of her scientific career.

March 26, 2020

Stanford students map free meals for Bay Area schoolchildren Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/26/stanford-students-map-free-meals-bay-area-schoolchildren/

An interdisciplinary team of Stanford students created a virtual map showing where local schoolchildren can receive free meals during school closures caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

March 26, 2020

Coordinated response needed to fight coronavirus pandemic Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/26/coordinated-response-needed-fight-coronavirus-pandemic/

Without coordination within and across countries, the novel coronavirus will endlessly reemerge, with devastating consequences for public health and the global economy, says Stanford scholar Matthew Jackson.

March 26, 2020

Understanding spread of COVID-19 Link: https://news.stanford.edu/2020/03/26/understanding-spread-covid-19/

Stanford professor Alexandria Boehm and visiting scholar Krista Wigginton describe potential transmission pathways of COVID-19 and their implications.
